sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>leader</radical> wishing to stop <radical>criminal</radical>s will write a moving <kanji>haiku</kanji>. The leader pleads with the criminals to stop their crimes, to look within, and to realize there's more to life (like poetry!).
meaningInfo: Unfortunately, the leader of the criminals also writes haiku, and they want all the criminals to keep doing crimes. Look inside and see how much you want what others have, write a haiku, and then steal!
readingMnemonic: A <kanji>haiku</kanji> is still a <reading>hai</reading>ku (<ja>はい</ja>). Whether it's written by a law abiding leader or a criminal leader.
readingInfo: Just remember: a haiku is always a haiku.
